きよ彦さん偲び、期間限定で遺品や着物を展示　５日から「まめ彦」で

04 Nov 2019

　１０月２８日に脳梗塞の疑いで都内の病院で亡くなった、毒舌タレントとして活躍していたきよ彦（本名、大堀清日古）さんが都内で営んでいた京風おでん店「まめ彦」で、５日から遺品や着物、写真などを展示し、期間限定で営業されることが４日、わかった。
　きよ彦さんはタレントや着物デザイナー、料理研究家として活躍する傍ら、２００３年に「まめ彦」を開店。２０１７年末にステージ４の下いん頭がんと宣告され入院、手術したが、退院後はすぐに「まめ彦」に顔を見せるなど、特に店を大切にしてきた。
　３日に密葬を済ませ、喪主を務めた長女と事務所などが相談。将来的に店は閉める方向で、話は進んでいるという。だが「きよ彦さんを偲びたい」という声も多く、「お別れ会」を執り行わない代わりに「まめ彦」での遺品などの展示となった。

Kiyohiko delights and exhibits relics and kimonos for a limited time at Mamehiko from 5th

04 Nov 2019

At the Kyoto-style oden shop “Mamehiko”, which was run in Tokyo by Kiyohiko (real name, Kihichi Ohori) who was active as a poisonous tongue talent who died at a hospital in Tokyo on suspicion of cerebral infarction on October 28 On the 4th, it was found that the relics, kimono, photos, etc. will be exhibited from the 5th and will be open for a limited time.
Kiyohiko opened “Mamehiko” in 2003 while working as a talent, kimono designer and cooking researcher. At the end of 2017, she was sentenced to stage 4 cancer of the head and was hospitalized and operated.
③ The eldest daughter, who served as a mourner, consulted with the office after a burial on the 3rd. The story is said to be closing in the future. However, there were many voices saying “I want to apologize for Kiyohiko-san”, and instead of holding a “farewell party”, it was an exhibition of relics at “Mamehiko”.
